title: New HMV boss Doug Putman calls for business rates overhaul
text:
Sajid Javid should get a move on and look at overhauling business rates, the Canadian businessman who saved HMV urged.

Doug Putman said the UK – and by extension the Chancellor, whose responsibility it is – should 'hurry up and look at' the levy that brutalises so many High Street stores.

The 35-year-old owner of record store Sunrise Records, which bought the UK music retailer, said rates were a major concern with the bill on some of HMV's stores 14 times as much as the rent.

HMV owner Doug Putman said the UK should 'hurry up and look at' the business rates which brutalising so many High Street stores

He warned in an interview that the UK is 'losing shops and jobs' because of the delay in looking at business rates. He said: 'You've got to hurry up and look at it.

'In almost every case our rates are higher than our rent, and our rates higher than profitability on a store. That's a concerning spot for everyone to be in.'

In some of his stores the rent is £20,000 and the rates £300,000.

'You look at that and you just kind of shake your head,' he said.

Department store John Lewis paid a total of £179million in rates last year – close to three times as much as Amazon pays.

'A store spokesman said the Government needs to 'conduct a fundamental review of business taxation'.

The Mail has campaigned for a review of the way business rates are levied on businesses to save the High Street.
